characters: TIGHT ON JUSTIN'S FACE AS THE LIGHTS COME ON
BOOM. BOOM. BOOM. POUNDING ON THE DOOR ITSELF
FLAMES SPREAD OVER WEIR'S BODY, TRANSFORMING HIM INTO THE
THUMP. A FACE PRESSES AGAINST THE GLASS, STARING BACK AT
...THE WALL BEHIND PETERS, CASED IN A FROZEN EXPLOSION OF
THERE'S SOMETHING UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC COVER
THEN THE VOID SUCKS HIM IN AND JUSTIN IS GONE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast field of stars. The gas giant Neptune slowly spins into view. Brilliant and blue and cold against the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands out against the planet, tiny against Neptune's sca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to discern the hard angles of a man-made craft. A ship. N longer dwarfed by the planet, the scale of the vessel eme a vast labyrinth of steel. Its shadow swallows all in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shafts of Neptune's blue light enter through windows,  illuminate debris suspended in the zero-gravity environme shards of metal and glass. MOVE from the Corridor into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cockpit for three. Neptune's blue light fills the chamb reflects off immobile particles in the air. Thick quartz  windows look down at Neptune. The cockpit lights are dark but for one blinking red light. An emergency beacon. Under-floor lights go on. The strobe of the red light reveals a man floating at the helm, slowly spinning. He is dead, perfectly preserved in the cold vacuum of space. His eyes are empty black pits a his mouth hangs open in a scream: DR. WILLIAM WEIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir opens his eyes, waking from dream. Sweat beads his  ascetic, etched face. Many years a scientist. He turns on the bedside lamp, revealing a couple's apartm Decorated by a woman, but Weir is alone, unless you count photographs. His nightstand looks like a shrine to a beau woman. Weir reaches to the stand. Picks up...

dialogues.speaker: RECENT, UNFRAMED PHOTO
dialogues.text: The woman appears thin and haggard and wears a small brav smile. Weir lies back on the bed. Looks at the photo. Presses it his forehead and closes his eyes. Trying to be with her,  just one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stands in front of the bathroom mirror, shaving with straight-razor. The mirror reveals the bathtub just behin him. DRIP, DRIP, DRIP... Weir turns to stare at the bathtub. Water wells up at the mouth of the tub's faucet, grows impossibly large, falls. DRIP. Weir turns back to his shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stands in the kitchenette, staring at the microwave it cooks his breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stands before his window, chewing his oatmeal  mechanically, forcing himself to swallow. He reaches out open the blinds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the blinds pull aside, revealing Weir, upside-down. ROTATE AND PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir's window is just one of many in a space station, a  delicate combination of cylindrical habitats and solar pa The structure hangs above the Earth in low orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A videophone RINGS OS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tinny) Dr. Weir, Admiral Hollis would like  to see you as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A military office, United States Aerospace Command seal  blazoned on the door. Views of the Earth. Admiral HOLLIS  sits behind his desk, a gruff career officer and a good m Weir enters, escorted by Hollis' adjutant, LYLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for the short notice,  Bill, but we've had something come  up that requires your immediate  attention. Lyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle activates a holographic display of the solar system. box magnifies the eighth planet, Neptune, revealing a fla red dot in its orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At oh-three-hundred this morning,  TDRSS picked up an automated  navigation beacon broadcasting at  two minute intervals in Neptune orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hands Weir a stack of hardcopy data. Weir reads the  data with growing excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible... These are the same  coordinates before the ship  disappeared... this, this happened?  This isn't some kind of hoax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't bring you here on a hoax.  Houston confirms the telemetry and  I.D. codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) It's the Event Horizon. She's come  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis answers drily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ship was lost in deep space,  seven years ago. If the Titanic sailed  into New York harbor, I'd find it  more plausible. (beat) Houston wants Aerospace to send out  a search and rescue team, investigate  the source of the transmission. If  it really is the Event Horizon,  they'll attempt a salvage. (beat) We need you to prepare a detailed  briefing on the ship's systems for  the salvage crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A written briefing can't possibly  anticipate the variables on a mission  like this. I have to go with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle looks at Weir, stunned by the request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir, you have no experience  with salvage procedures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I designed the ship's propulsion  system. I am the only person capable  of evaluating the performance of the  gravity drive. You can't send a Search  and Rescue team out there alone and  expect them to succeed. That would  be like... like sending an auto- mechanic to work on the shuttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand your desire to redeem  your reputation, Dr. Weir, but it  doesn't factor into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not about my reputation!  This is not about me at all! (beat, passionate) The Event Horizon was created for  one reason: to go faster than light.  Imagine mankind exploring new solar  systems, colonizing new worlds. Seven  years ago, we didn't just lose the  ship and the crew. We lost the dream. (beat, quiet and  relentless) I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple. (off of Weir's  expression) Lyle, play the recording for Dr.  Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navigation Control tried to hail the  vessel. This was the only response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle presses a button on Hollis' desk. An unholy GARBLE r from office speakers: STATIC and NOISE and INHUMAN VOICES Alone, each sound would raise the hair on your neck. Toge they are unbearable. The sound mercifully cuts off to STATIC. Lyle stops the t Weir sits there, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the initial transmission,  there's been no further contact.  Just the beacon, every two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew? Could they still be alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship had life support systems  for eighteen months. They're been  gone seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone sent that message. Admiral,  you have to put me on that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis stares at Weir, judging the man with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's against my better judgement,  but I'll run this by the Man  downstairs. You'll know my decision  by the end of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me, Bill. I'm not doing  you any favors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir leaves. The door closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not seriously considering  sending him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't just dismiss Bill Weir.  The man held Oppenheimer's chair at  Princeton. If the Event Horizon had  worked, he would have gone down in  history as the greatest mind in  physics since Einstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official inquiry blamed Weir's  design for the ship's loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean a damn thing. They  were looking for a scapegoat and  Weir fit the bill. But he's not  responsible for what happened to the  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't belong on this mission.  Responsible or not, he blames himself.  He's too close to it. (beat) And then there's his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been two years since she died.  He's over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things you don't get over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want our best people on this.  Where's Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark just returned  from patrol in the asteroid belt,  she's docked in bay four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark pulls away from Daylight station, tur towards the depths of space. It is a tough-looking spacec all engine. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IN on thick quartz windows near the ship's nose: the bridge... Split level. Above: avionics, navigation, flight control. STARCK (female, Navigator, sharp mind, sharp tongue) chec the navigation data on her screen as SMITH (male, Pilot,  wrapped too tight) punches in the course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this, I haven't gotten  more than my hand in six weeks and  now this shit. Why not Mars, Cap,  Mars has women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith's right. Neptune? There's  nothing out there. If something  happens, we'll be on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain's chair drops from above, swivels to reveal M (male, Captain, intense).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it either, but you know  the rules: we get the call, we go.  Is the course locked in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked and cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're past the outer marker, we can  engage the ion drive whenever you're  ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below: the bridge's "war-room" -- ship's systems and miss stations. JUSTIN (male, Engineer, young hot-shot).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything green on my boards,  Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ion drive will engage in... T-minus  ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller slides down a ladder into the war-room. The others follow into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bulky EVA (extra-vehicular activity) suits line the walls MUSIC blares from a JAMBOX, built into a storage locker. An Emergency Tech stows safety lines: COOPER -- male, the resident pain-in-the-ass. He SINGS along with the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not breaking stride) Kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper reaches up, turns off the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to play Spam in the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start with me, Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper falls in as the crew continues into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence of long term habitation. Personalized lockers. F down bunks, chairs, tables; currently stowed for docking. modular galley. PETERS (female, Emergency Technician, the crew's denmothe and DJ (male, Doctor, a cold perfectionist) load CO2 scru into a bin in the floor. Weir stands to the side like a fifth wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Miller, I just want to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock is running, Dr. Weir. If  you'll follow the rest of the crew,  they'll show you to the gravity tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir hesitates, then follows the crew into Medical. Mille hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hold up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just loading the last of the CO2  scrubbers. (to Miller, accusatory) Good for four months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put in for a replacement for you  but no one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, its alright. I talked to my  ex, he'll keep Denny over Christmas  and I'll get him this summer. (beat) Goddam it, Skipper... I haven't seen  him in two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry. But now we have to go to  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high tech operating room. Modular equipment. Vertical t line the walls, each large enough to hold a human being:  gravity couches. The crew stands before the gravity couches, almost nude, room for modesty. Starck catches Cooper looking at her ass as she strips to her undergarments. Cooper grins. She flips him off, not  bothering to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that an offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller disrobes. Two service tags hang around his neck. H does not remove them. Weir approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Miller, I appreciate this  opportunity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Weir, my crew is not going on  your mission because we want to. We  were pulled off a well deserved leave,  to be sent out to the middle of  nowhere, and no one's even told us  why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been authorized to brief you  and the crew once we reach Neptune  space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until then, do what you're told and  stay out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir nods, moves to an empty couch bearing his name, writ on a piece of tape. Peters watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time in a grav couch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks Weir's couch, helps him climb in. Weir keeps o eye on Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off of Weir's glance) Don't worry about it. He's hard, but  he's fair. You're lucky to be shipping  out with him. He's one of the few  Captains in the service with  experience in the Outer Reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been past Mars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He served on the Goliath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't that ship destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) They attempted to rescue a supply  shuttle bound for Titan. The shuttle's  oh-two tanks ruptured during the  rescue, flooded both ships with pure  oxygen. There was a spark and both  ships were incinerated. The Skipper  and three others just made it to a  lifeboat. Captain Miller was able...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) He doesn't like to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ swathes one of Weir's arms with alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't eat anything in the past  twelve hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Ion drive fires, we'll be  taking about 30 gees. Without a tank,  the force would liquefy your skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ injects Weir. The scientist winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen the effect on mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overhead lights change to red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ hands him the breathing mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir does. DJ checks the fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. You'll wake up and  we'll be there. Watch your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ closes the tank. It begins to fill with green gel. Wei eyes grow large with fear and then the anaesthesia hits. eyes close. His body draws into a fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking the monitor) Heart-rate decreasing... body temp  dropping to 80... 70... 60... 50...  40 degrees Fahrenheit. He's in stasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ION ENGINE at the aft of the ship begins to glow a de red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew hang inert in the gravity couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. The engine flares white hot. The Lewis and Clark lances forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark races SILENTLY past. The engine at it aft holds a sustained fusion reaction like the sun. GRAPHIC: U.S.S. Lewis and Clark. 56 days out.

dialogues.speaker: WEIR
dialogues.text: immobile in the grav tank. He might be sleeping. He might dead. A distant SOUND echoes though the ship, the unholy  garble of human and inhuman voices -- it is the Event Hor calling to him -- the sound refines into a WOMAN'S VOICE, more than a WHISPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir's grav tank opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the seven bodies of the crew, suspended inert in the gel. A sound: DRIP... DRIP... DRIP... Weir slowly walks to the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A naked WOMAN sits at the helm, her back to us. Completel still. Her skin is very pale. Water pools around her chai Weir stands behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative) Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does not answer. She does not move. Weir reaches out touch her shoulder, then pulls his hand back, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire? I'm sorry. Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out again. He touches her hair. She doesn't mo Weir catches her reflection in the computer monitors.  Something wrong with her face... He starts to spin her ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir awakes with a jolt, in his grav couch. His mask has  slipped. His tank has filled with blood. He is drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reality. Weir's eyes open. He presses against the glass o the tank, trying to force it open, panicked. The others a already stepping from open tanks. Weir's tank opens with a HISS. He tumbles to the floor,  gasping, fluid streaming from his mouth. Peters rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ! (to Weir) It's okay. You're okay. Just breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir catches his breath. He looks up. The crew surrounds  him, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright now. I'm alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move slowly. You've been in stasis  for fifty-six days. You're going to  experience a little disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Dr. Weir, don't scare us like  that. Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, still butt-naked and proud of it, grabs a metal  cylinder from the wall and pours a mug for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Starck. You wanna dry my back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck gives him a cool once over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe when you finish puberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller zips up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck, why aren't you on the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just finished drying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here? Come  on, people, let's go! (to Cooper) And Cooper... Put some pants on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. The Lewis and Clark drifts towards Neptune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew has secured the quarters from flight status. Bun have been folded down, each alcove personalized with  photographs and pin-ups. DJ moves around the cabin, checking the crew's radiation  badges. Cooper and Justin sit on their bunks, tossing a handball  across the cabin. Peters holds a "Watchman" video unit, watching a "video  letter"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from DENNY, her four-year-old son, a paraplegic, grinn widely in his new wheelchair:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video) Play horsey, Mommy, play horsey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE VIDEO, Peters enters shot, scoops her child from t chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video) Want to play horsey, do you... (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir sits huddled in a blanket. Miller takes a seat next him. Starck and Smith enter. Starck sits next to Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 hours to Neptune orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All boards are green, everything's  five by five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good to know. Justin, you  wanna stow that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin catches the ball, holds onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up. As you all know by  now, we have an addition to our crew.  Dr. Weir, this is: Starck, navigation;  Smith, pilot, Justin, ship's engineer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call him Baby-bear, he loves  that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Cooper, what the hell do you  do on this ship, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Weir) I am your best friend. I am a  lifesaver and a heartbreaker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a rescue technician. Peters,  medical technician. DJ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is mission specialist Dr.  William Weir. We all know where we're  going. Dr. Weir is going to tell us  why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and the crew look at Weir, waiting. Weir clears hi throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I am about to tell you is  considered code-black by the NSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew look at each other: they haven't heard that in a mission briefing before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means top-secret, Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The USAC intercepted a radio  transmission from a decaying orbit  around Neptune. The source has been  identified as the Event Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUNNED SILENCE. Then everyone talks at once:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible! She was lost with  all hands, what, seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years ago, the reactor blew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we salvage...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the dead rest, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cancel our leave and send us out  on some bullshit mission...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY SHUT UP! Let the man speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the quiet that follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was made public about the Event  Horizon, that she was a deep space  research vessel, that its reactor  went critical, that the ship blew  up... None of that is true. (beat) The Event Horizon was the culmination  of a secret government project to  create a spacecraft capable of faster- than-light flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stares at Weir: he has just dropped another bomb them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law of relativity prohibits faster- than-light travel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relativity, yes. We can't break the  law of relativity, but we can go  around it. The ship doesn't really  move faster than the speed of light;  it creates a dimensional gateway  that allows the ship to  instantaneously "jump" from one point  in the universe to another, light  years away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in layman's terms, you use a  rotating magnetic field to focus a  narrow beam of gravitons; these in  turn fold space-time consistent with  Weyl tensor dynamics until the space- time curvature becomes infinitely  large and you have a singularity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laymen's terms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir thinks of another way to explain it. He rips a pin-u from Smith's locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say this paper represents space-time,  and you want to get from "point A"  here... (marks it on the photo  with a pen) ...to "point B," here. (marks point B) Now: what's the shortest distance  between two points?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stares at him. Starck decides to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A straight line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. The shortest distance between  two points...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir folds the paper, lining up point A over point B... t THRUSTING his pen through both, skewering the pin-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is zero. That's what the  singularity does: it folds space, so  that point A and point B coexist in  the same space and time. After the  ship passes through this gateway,  space returns to normal. (hands the ruined pin- up back to Smith) It's called a gravity drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Cooper is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see why they sent you along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if the ship didn't blow up, what  happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the ship's maiden voyage, to  test the drive. The Event Horizon  moved to safe distance using ion  thrusters. They received the go-ahead  to activate the gravity drive. (beat) And the ship vanished from all our  scopes. No radar contact, no enhanced  optical, no radio contact of any  kind. They disappeared without a  trace. (beat) Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where has it been for the last seven  years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're here to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark flashes silently past, heading deeper and deeper into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew assembled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't been able to confirm any  live contact, but TDRSS did receive  a single transmission from the Event  Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir punches a button on a console. The transmission BLAR from the bridge's speakers, STATIC and NOISE and, underne all, INHUMAN VOICES. The crew listen, look at one another. The recording ends  abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't sound like anything human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston has passed the recording  through several filters and isolated  what appears to be a human voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He activates a different file. The resulting WAIL is more human but no less terrifying, a cry of despair. The last  message from a drowning man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latin? Who the fuck speaks Latin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. It's a dead language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NSA encryption specialists have  deciphered some of the message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir plays the HELLISH INCANTATION for a third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There: "...liberatis me..." They  haven't been able to translate the  rest, it's too distorted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Liberatis me." "Save me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Weir) You're convinced the crew could still  be alive? After seven years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Event Horizon only had life  support for eighteen months. It seems  impossible, but in light of the  transmission... I have to think that  someone has managed to endure until  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, do we get hazard pay for  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the tape, Smith. We're  looking for survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark closes in on the blue planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight crew assembled. Data flashes across the main  monitors on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossing the horizon. Optimum approach  angle is fourteen degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come around to three-three-four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoing) Heading three-three-four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...Make your approach vector negative  fourteen degrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-four degrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RCS thrusters pivot and fire as the ship enters Neptune o dropping lower and lower into the dense blue clouds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship begins to rock as it encounters atmosphere, a gr vibration. GRAPHICS flash across the main window's HUD. Neptune's da shadow fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a lock on the Event Horizon's  navigation beacon. It's in the upper  ionosphere, we're in for some chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us in tight. Starck, get on  the horn, see if anyone's listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) This is U.S. Aerospace Command vessel  Lewis and Clark, hailing Event  Horizon, Event Horizon, do you  read...? This is the Lewis and Clark,  hailing... (she continues B.G.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Starck) Matching speed... now. Range to target  ten thousand meters and closing...  Skipper, I got a bad feeling about  this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all on edge, Smith. We're a  long way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it. That ship was built  to go faster than light... That's  just wrong, it goes against everything  we know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say? "If God  had intended Man to fly, he would  have given us wings?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller grins grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're about to find out.  Keep us slow and steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir sticks his head into the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you want to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir climbs up the ladder to the flight deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead ahead, 5000 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the ship SHUDDERS VIOLENTLY. Weir braces himself in the doorway, staring out the forwa window into the roiling azure clouds. Smith grimaces, his knuckles white at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got some weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed. Starck, anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they are, they're screening their  calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range 3000 meters and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only turbid clouds of methane ice whirl past the Lewis an Clark's windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1500 meters. We're getting too  close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her console) The scope is lit, it's right in front  of us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1000 meters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red warning light begins to flash in time with a shrill BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proximity warning! 900, 800 meters,  700... we're right on top of it,  we're gonna hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, trails off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the clouds break, revealing... THE EVENT HORIZON, right in front of them. A black  labyrinthine blasphemy against Neptune's arctic blue. Clo banks encircle the ship as if it were the eye of a hurric

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse thrusters full!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Event Horizon looms enormous as the Lewis and Clark h off the port stern, dwarfed by the giant ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbulence subsides. The bridge crew stares at the ma craft. The only sound, the PROXIMITY WARNING. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that is one big ugly fat  fucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller reaches over Smith's shoulder, turns off the proxi warning. Smith snaps back to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range 500 meters and holding.  Turbulence is dropping off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking up magnetic interference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it through TACS. Smith, you up  for a flyby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he is not) Love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark maneuvers in close to the Event Horiz dwarfed by the dark ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith keeps a tight hand on the controls. The crew stare the viewport at the abandoned craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the size of that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir explains the view out the cockpit window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foredecks. Crew quarters, bridge,  medical and science labs, hydroponics,  what have you. That central section  connects the forward decks to the  Engineering containment area. Can we  move in closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Doc, any closer and we're gonna  need a rubber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith grimaces. His hands move carefully over the control

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark moves even closer. Vanishing into the shadow of the Event Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stares at the ship rushing past the viewport. A  huge spherical structure looms eerily ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the engineering containment.  And there's the main airlock. We can  dock there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, use the arm and lock us onto  that antennae cluster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. It's not a load bearing  structure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark carefully maneuvers in close to the E Horizon's airlock. A mechanical boom-arm extends from the smaller ship to la onto the Event Horizon. Its clawed hand grabs the antenna cluster. The cluster buckles under the stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Weir) It is now. (to Miller) We're locked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck, give me a read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scan of the Event Horizon appears across Starck's scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reactor's still hot. We've got  several small radiation sources,  leaks probably. Nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative. The hull's intact...  but there's no gravity and the thermal  units are off line. I'm showing deep  cold. The crew couldn't survive unless  they were in stasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find 'em, Starck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck frowns at her display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong with the bio-scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radiation interference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not enough radiation to throw  off the scan. I'm picking up trace  life forms, but I can't get a lock  on the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be the crew? If they were  in suspended animation, wouldn't  that effect the scan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they were in stasis, I'd get a  location, but these readings, they're  all over the ship. It doesn't make  any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We do it the hard way. Deck by  deck, room by room. Starck, deploy  the umbilicus. I believe you're up  for a walk, Mr. Justin. Go get your  bonnet on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir starts to follow Justin from the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir, I need you on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I didn't come out here to  sit on your bridge, I need to be on  that ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the ship is secured, we'll bring  you on board --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) That is not acceptable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) -- once we've secured the ship, that's  the way it is! (beat) I need you to guide us from the comm  station. This is where I need you.  Help us to do our job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The docking collar umbilicus extends to the Event Horizon airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Peters, Justin and Cooper in EVA; Cooper and Just without headgear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...come on, Skipper, I already put  my shoes on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) You've had plenty EVA, Coop, it's  Justin's turn. Stay on station. If  anything happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller nods to Peters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Opening inner airlock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inner airlock door opens: CH-THUNK. Miller, Peters an Justin enter the airlock. Justin attaches his safety line Miller and Peters do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still need the rope? I thought  you were one a those spacemen with  ice in ya veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather be on the rope and not  need it than need it and not have  it. Now step aside, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper puts Justin's helmet on. It seals tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious now) You just keep your nose clean, Baby  Bear. Clear the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper backs out, allowing the inner airlock door to shut ECHOING through the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Peters and Justin float down the brightly lit  umbilicus into the Event Horizon, all in EVA suits. Justi safety line trails out behind him. The OUTER AIRLOCK DOOR of the Event Horizon waits for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir has taken over Justin's station. He watches the POV  monitors like a kid watching Christmas. Smith and Starck  keep tabs over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've reached the outer airlock  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters attaches a thumper -- a device using sound waves t measure pressure -- to the inner airlock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear and open on my mark. Three...  two... one... mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters inserts a zero-G drill into the panel beside the d The door slowly opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immense corridor stretches away into darkness in both directions. Distantly spaced windows manifest as remote p of blue light amidst endless black, adding to the vast se of scale. The light from their dual spotlights on the team's helmet reflects off tiny ice crystals of frozen atmosphere. They are ants in a tomb built for giants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus its huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice crystals everywhere. This place  is a deep freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) You're in the central corridor. It  connects the personnel areas to  Engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters and I will search the forward  decks. Justin, take Engineering. No  hot-dogging, not on this one, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group separates. Justin kicks off from the wall, shoo down the corridor at immense speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Peters move in the opposite direction. They us magnetic plates on their boots and gloves to cling to the walls as they slowly make their way down the dark shaft.  Their journey seems endless. The darkness almost seems a  living thing as it surrounds them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller spots something at a coupling, where two sections the corridor join...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir, what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller indicates a box nestled against the coupling. The  universal symbol for explosives is on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ahead at the next  coupling) Here's another one. They're all over  the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) They're explosive charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that, what're they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an emergency, the charges detonate  in series, destroying the central  section and separating the personnel  areas from the rest of the ship.  That way, if the gravity drive  malfunctions, the crew could use the  foredecks as a lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters and Miller keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means they didn't abandon ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are they? Starck, any luck  with the bio-scan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running diagnostics now,  Skipper... Nothing's wrong with the  sensor pack, I'm still getting trace  life readings, all over the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Peters unconsciously look around. Sweat beads  their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one in the corridor but  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Not according to the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is right, no one's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, this place is really  dark, I can't see a thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to wave her searchlight around wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming her down) Easy, Peters, we're okay, we're okay.  Let's finish the sweep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Captain Miller, the foredecks are  just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck, you still showing those  readings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) That's an affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peters) Keep your eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods as he reaches for the hatch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch opens, allowing Peters and Miller entrance into the forward decks. These areas were intended for human  habitation, and seem similar in design to the Lewis and C only larger. Gravity couches line both walls, eighteen in all. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the gravity couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir peers eagerly at the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any survivors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope drains from Weir's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're empty, Dr. Weir. Moving  forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Peters split up, each taking a separate exit f the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir looks at Justin's POV screen: a grainy image of the  First Containment Seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin stands before a thick pressure door. Justin checks the door with his thumper, his boots are now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) You've reached the First Containment  Seal. The engineering decks are on  the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have pressure. The radiation  count's steady at 7 millirads an  hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Background radiation. Perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin touches a panel beside the door. It opens. He ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a long corridor shaped like a tube. It rotates like a  turbine, causing vertigo. Justin's BREATH echoes in his h as he moves forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares at Justin's safety line in the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAFETY LINE
dialogues.text: counts off silently, passing 150 meters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor ends at a pressure door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir, what's this the door to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) You're at the Bridge, Ms. Peters.  You still haven't seen any crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, moving through a deserted lab. Empty operating ta Stainless steel surgical instruments float in zero-G. A g floats up behind him, brushes his shoulder. He wheels... glove is empty. It spins away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we saw any crew, Doctor, you'd  know about it. (looking around) I'm in Medical. No casualties, it  looks like this place has never been  used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds a computer console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters enters. Looks around: a small antechamber for crew briefings, with chairs and a display table. Red crystals  float in a crimson mist around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir peers at the monitors, trying to make out the red ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we can see some kind of mist.  What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Blood. Looks like arterial spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Can you see a body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) There's no one here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) The blood came from somewhere,  Peters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one here, Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters takes a sample container from her belt. Carefully  tries to capture a suspended crystal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and the Container; Peters' brow furrowed with concentrati

dialogues.speaker: ...THE WALL BEHIND PETERS, CASED IN A FROZEN EXPLOSION OF
dialogues.text: BLOOD AND TISSUE. Someone died here in a violent and terr way. Peters starts to look up but the flash dies away. She nev saw the horror behind her. Peters turns her attention back to her tiny crystal. She  traps the it, returns the container to her belt. She moves from the antechamber into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her helmet lights sweep the room. Every surface a control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) What you got, Peters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters examines the other consoles -- most are dark but f a few dim lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's been shut down.  Conserving power, I guess. Green  light on the hull, it's intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The science workstation has power,  I'll see if I can find the crew from  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stares at Peters' monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Peters, turn back and to your  left, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her monitor, Peters' POV shifts as she complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ship's log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters reaches towards a small video deck. Touches the ej button. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin's light bounces off an even larger pressure door,  built like a bank vault. The Second Seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've reached another containment  door. This thing's huge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) That's the Second Containment Seal.  Beyond that, engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin opens the seal. It releases SLOWLY, inching open.  Justin squeezes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters takes a small probe from her belt, inserts it into the video deck. A small laser disc emerges partway from the deck. Peters  pulls on it. It doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really jammed in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow crosses the window behind her. Someone -- someth is in there with her... Peters pulls harder. Nothing. Another effort. The disc pu free. Peters spins in the zero-gravity, spinning into... ...A BODY floating at the helm, the face illuminated by  Peters' helmet lights. His swollen tongue clogs his gapin screaming mouth. His cracked and crystallized skin is cro by a network of bloated veins. He has no eyes. Just like  Weir's dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters' monitor shows the CORPSE'S face, its mouth open i mute agony. Weir GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters pushes free of the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (professional) I found one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead man's face leers from Peters' monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to his eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosive decompression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decompression wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir just stares at the ruined face, rapt. Starck notices

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir nods, not taking his eyes from the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, on station. He keys his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Baby Bear, Mama Bear got a  corpsicle for ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks up from the workstation, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Baby Bear, you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares out at Justin's safety line slowly counting off past 175 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second Seal is open. Justin's safety line snakes into darkness. FOLLOW the safety line into the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alcove, opening into a vast chamber. Once pristine, al the surfaces have been coated in a dark gray slick. Globu of fluid hang motionless, sticking to Justin's suit, leec away his light and swallowing him in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) ...do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Uh, yeah Coop, I'm still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Shit! Do not do that! Where the fuck  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the Second Containment area.  It's pitch black in here. There must  have been a coolant leak. Man, this  shit is everywhere. I can't see a  damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lighted console blocks Justin's view of the chamber bey He drifts over to it, wipes the console clear of coolant, revealing dim lights: the station has power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reactor's still hot. Coolant  level is on reserve, but still in  the green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumph) I got it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expressions changes as he looks past the console and  sees... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trailing off in awe) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I found something...

dialogues.speaker: THE CORE
dialogues.text: A massive sphere, 10 meters in diameter, dominates the ce of the second containment. Intricate machinery surrounds sphere but the globe itself is featureless, smooth; a  enigmatic monolith. Black ice encrusts it, giving it the  seeming of a living thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at Justin's monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Core: the gravity drive.  The heart of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin, check the containment for  radiation leaks. Peters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) ...how's the client?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystallized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin examines the outer wall of the Core, looking for a cracks or ruptured seams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin, finish your sweep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done, I just gotta check one  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin turns to the Core...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin's monitor fills with static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, hold on a sec, you're breaking  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin...? (static obscure her  voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin reaches towards the Core with his pressure sensor. His helmet light flickers. He hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's helmet light flickers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's helmet light winks out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the bio-scan lights up, from green to red as si race across the display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The life readings just  went off the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin places the pressure sensor against the Core. Touch it. The Core turns deepest black. A darkness that light canno penetrate. For a second, Justin's white suit is captured  against the hungry void...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stares in shock as Justin's safety line as it reel out at an incredible rate -- 250 meters, 300 meters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surges out of the Core, bending light like a ripple on a  pond, pushing coolant and debris before it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gravity wave surges forward, blowing out emergency li as it comes, flotsam and jetsam swirling in its wake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data floods Miller's workstation, flashing across the scr too fast for comprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEEP ROAR fills the ship. Miller rises to investigate.. The door BLOWS APART as THE WAVE HITS, ripples through th Medical Bay towards Miller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris swirls around him... the wave sweeps him up... SLA him into a bulkhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the briefest suggestion of a SCREAMING FACE, obscured by  STATIC and ROLL before the screen CUTS to static entirely The rest of the crew's POV screens go dead as... ...the wave hits them, threatening to tear the Lewis and  Clark apart. The ship shudders violently. Consoles EXPLOD with sparks. Weir and the others hold on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, do you read me, Peters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, goddammit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An equipment rack IGNITES. Smith grabs an extinguisher, f the blaze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and DJ, bracing against the bulkhead. Cooper hits intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) I don't know, the screens are dead...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper peers out the airlock window.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN'S SAFETY LINE
dialogues.text: passes 350 meters and accelerating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 350 meters... 400 meters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in trouble. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper grabs his helmet. DJ helps him lock the helmet int place with a HISS. The inner airlock door opens. As Cooper enters the airloc Justin's safety reel stops, the line jerking taut at 500  meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller tries to get his bearings in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarding party, sound off... Peters,  do you read me... . Peters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters' light, too, remains dark, but Neptune's blue ligh fills the Bridge. The frozen corpse floats before her. No longer a man. A young boy, maybe five years old. His legs are withered, useless things. The skin remains a crystallized surface, the eyes look straight at her, alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters reaches out to touch the body. It falls away from  her. No longer her son, but the body of the astronaut. It hits the door and shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing desperation) ...Peters, do you read me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S VOICE, in agony, CRACKLES over Miller's radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Don't leave me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin? Justin, sound off...  Justin...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller trails off as RED LIGHT flickers across his visor. turns...

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: A BURNING MAN stands in Medical/Science, a human body wre in flame. The eyes are like sunspots. As the Burning Man  moves, bones and black flesh poke through the fire. He ra one hand to point at Miller in accusation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's BREATH stops in his throat. His mouth works but  nothing comes out. He BLINKS... ...and the VISION is gone. Miller is alone, BREATHING har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper enters at full speed, shooting through in a contro fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Baby Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the Second Containment. He catches himself at the console. Cooper sees Justin's safety line, cut off abrupt by the darkness of the Core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness of the Core ripples... Justin suddenly emerges from the darkness, a white figure riding a wave of impenetrable blackness. Cooper catches him, holds him tight as the wave carries t towards the wall. Cooper sees a control rod -- a long met spike -- coming at them. He twists his body so that they  miss -- barely -- before slamming into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, do you read me? Justin... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper pulls Justin close. Justin's head lolls to one sid Unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Bear, don't do this. Don't do  this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir, Starck and Smith continue to hold on tightly as the vibration builds... and builds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes another one! Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second wave hits. Sparks fly as consoles EXPLODE. Dee in the ship metal SCREAMS, followed by the SHRIEK of esca atmosphere. An emergency klaxon RINGS out: PRESSURE WARNI Starck checks Justin's station:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost the starboard baffle! The  hull's been breached!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bridge pressure door begins to close...and then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safety circuit's failed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are pressure suits in the  Airlock. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck pushes Weir ahead of her, Smith follows hard as th run the length of the ship for the airlock bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vibration subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can anybody hear me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Skipper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) ...you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm -- I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice cracks as she says it. She looks anything but.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reports come, one on the other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) We have a man down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop, where are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) The containment, Second Containment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Coop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Captain Miller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, where the hell have you been?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a situation here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck and Smith already in suits. DJ assists Weir. Smith has already locked his helmet into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We lost the starboard baffle and the  hull cracked. Our safety seals didn't  close, the circuit's fried --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller moves down the central corridor towards his wounde ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have enough time for a weld?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) We don't have time to fart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing pressure at 280 liters  a second and our oxygen tanks are  cracked. In three minutes, our  atmosphere will be gone. We are  fucking dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's dying on my watch, Smith!  What about the reserve tanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Miller closes his eyes, desperately trying to think a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN across the faces of the astronauts. No hope. Except f Weir:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Event Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others turn to stare at Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still has air and reserve power,  we can activate gravity and life  support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the air has gone bad? We  can't wear these suits forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is a good idea,  we don't even know what happened on  that ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats dying, Mister Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir's right. Get on board the  Event Horizon. I'll meet you at the  airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, Smith. Peters, are you  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters at the life support console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ahead of you. Bringing the thermal  units on line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters flips a series of circuit-breakers. Reaches for th final switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold tight and prep for gees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything floating in the bridge CRASHES to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin and Cooper collapse to the deck, coolant splashing down all around them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller meets the crew as they evacuate the Lewis and Clar Weir leads the way, eager; Smith hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's find out how much time  we just bought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller reaches for the catch on his own helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't tested the air yet. It  could be contaminated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time. We need whatever's left in  our suits to repair the Clark. Like  it or not, this is the only oxygen  for three billion kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller pulls his helmet off with a HISS. He breathes deep Starck does the same, coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tastes bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can breathe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis and Clark and the Event Horizon, locked togethe in Neptune orbit. Lights shine from the Horizon as power restored. No longer cloaked in darkness, it is revealed i all its hideous glory, a nightmare etched in steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir moves from station to station, restoring power to ea Starck sits at the communications workstation. Miller wat over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antennae array's completely fried,  we've got no radio, no laser, no  highgain... No one's going to be  coming to help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much oh-two do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygen is not the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carbon dioxide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) It's building up with every breath  we take. And the CO2 filters on the  Event Horizon are shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can take the filters from the  Clark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought of that, with the filters  from the Clark, we've got enough  breathable air for twenty hours.  After that, we'd better be on our  way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the life readings you  picked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Event Horizon sensors show the  same thing: "Bio-readings of  indeterminate origin." Right before  that wave hit the Clark, there was  some kind of surge, right off the  scale, but now it's back to its  previous levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's causing the readings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but whatever it is,  it's not the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is the rest of the crew?  We've been over every inch of this  ship and all we've found is blood.  Dr. Weir? Any suggestions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir just stares at the bloodstained wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller follows Weir's gaze to the wall: a Rorschach test blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK from the bridge windows TO REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Event Horizon in all its horrific glory, hanging s in the center of the hurricane like a mote in God's eye. The Lewis and Clark clings to the giant craft, as  insignificant as a tick. An even smaller figure clings to the hull of the Lewis and Clark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Smith, EVA in full protective gear. His magnetic boo hold him to the Lewis and Clark's hull. He kneels over a  hole in the hull, where the metal has buckled and torn. V still leaks from the hole into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Miller, you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) I'm here, Smith, how's the Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found a six inch fracture in  the outer hull. We should be able to  repair it and re-pressurize, it's  gonna take some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) We don't have time, Smith. In twenty  hours we run out of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith uses a foam applicator to fill the hole. The gel fr in place. Smith reaches to his belt, pulls out a ZERO-G  NAILGUN. Presses it to the patch and begins to rivet it i place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin lies unmoving on a table. His eyes are open, stari at a smear of blood on the ceiling. A needle slides into the skin below his eye. He doesn't  respond. DJ removes the needle. It glistens with blood. He looks u at Miller and Peters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His vitals are stable, but he's  unresponsive to stimuli. He might  wake up in fifteen minutes. He might  not wake up at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ shakes his head. Miller eyes the bloodstain above them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, take samples from these stains,  compare them to medical records, I  want to know whose blood this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity has scattered debris and freeze-dried blood about the room. The crew (Justin and Smith excepted) tries to r on the chairs of dead men. Their faces are wan and haggar Weir relaxes at the table. Unlike the others, he seems al at ease. DJ remains forever stoic; Starck, animated and  nervous. Cooper bounces the handball on the floor, a refl action. Miller stares at a video monitor, watching Smith repair t Lewis and Clark. He turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, people, there's been a change  in the mission. In less than eighteen  hours, we will run out of breathable  air. Our primary objective is now  survival. That means we focus on  repairing the Lewis and Clark and  salvaging whatever will buy us more  time. (pause) Our secondary objective is finding  out what happened to this ship and  its crew. Two months from now, I  fully intend to be standing in front  of the good Admiral giving my report,  and I'd like to have more than my  dick in my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim smiles all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters, I want you to go through the  ship's log, see if we can't find  some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can use the station in Medical,  keep an eye on Justin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Starck, I want you to repeat  the bio-scan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? I'll just get the  same thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not acceptable. I want to know what's  causing those readings. If the crew  is dead, I want the bodies, I want  the crew found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can reconfigure the scan for C-12,  amylase proteins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Dr. Weir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my men is down. I want to  know what happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. He was inside the Core...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir starts shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like... nothing was there...  and then Justin appeared and the  Core... became metal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) No, he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't there. I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what, Mr. Cooper? What did you  really see, because what you're  describing is not physically  possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper throws the ball at him, hard. Weir ducks. It bounc wildly around the room. Miller catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on Weir) Dr. Weir, Justin may die. Whatever  happened to him could happen to all  of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened to Justin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, I saw it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you saw could have been an  optical effect caused by gravitational  distortion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on Weir) I know what I saw and it wasn't a  fucking "optical effect!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, what's this "gravitational  distortion?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible that a burst of gravity  waves escaped from the Core,  distorting space-time. They could be  what hit the Lewis and Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could cause them? (Weir doesn't answer) What's in the Core?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do you need? We have  seventeen hours and forty-two minutes.  Now: what is in the Core?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Here comes another bomb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stares at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
