dialogues.text: Miller, Starck and Weir stand before the Core. Dark omino structures loom around them, glistening with coolant. The PULSE of the ship is loud here, a deep THRUM that steals  their breath. Weir's voice is a reverent WHISPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how the gravity drive works,  you see: it focuses the black hole's  immense gravitational power to create  the gateway. That's how the Event  Horizon travels faster than light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we built this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Insane?" The finest astronauts fought  to be posted to this ship. It would  take the Lewis and Clark a thousand  years to reach our closest star. The  Event Horizon could be there in a  day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it worked, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at the Core, the surrounding machinery moving a slow giant's dance. A trick of the eye, or does the Cor stare back at them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this room sealed. The Second  Containment is off limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no danger. The black hole is  contained behind three magnetic  fields, it's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your black hole damn near ripped my  ship apart. It may have killed one  of my men. (beat) No one goes near that thing.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE IN ON THE CORE
dialogues.text: until its darkness fills the screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters sits before the computer workstation, running the  ship's log, forwarding through hours of boring footage. R her eyes. The lights flicker. Peters hears something RUSTLING behind her. She turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin lies unmoving on the nearest examination table.  Comatose. Peters reaches out and picks up a scalpel. Peters hears the sound again, FINGERNAILS ON PLASTIC. She moves past Justin... ...past several empty tables, covered with clear plastic. ...to the last table. She stares in shock.

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S SOMETHING UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC COVER
dialogues.text: She slowly reaches out. Lifts the cover. Her son DENNY looks at her and GIGGLES. She GASPS. The sc drops to the floor at her feet. Denny reaches up to her, to be picked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but the plastic that still covers his withered legs sq like a bag full of snakes... Peters drops the plastic and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. DJ stands in the doorway, holding blood sample Peters turns back, but her son is gone. DJ reads her expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Airlock light turns red -- a warning. The Inner Airlo door control flashes: "LOCKED." The Outer Airlock door op Smith enters. He closes the Outer Airlock door. Atmospher HISSES into the chamber. The Inner Airlock door flashes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper in EVA, getting ready to go outside. The Inner Air door opens. Smith enters. Takes off his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been out there a long time. Trying  to break my record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather spend the next twelve  hours Outside than another five  minutes in this can. This ship is  bad. It watches you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. This ship, it's crazy:  trying to go faster'n light, that's  like the Tower of Babel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Smith, you're going Biblical  on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what happened to the Tower  of Babel, don't you? It fell down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sucking too much nitrogen in  your mix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck programs the sensor workstation. She glances over Weir: sitting at a computer terminal, his face rapt as da flashes by. His lips move, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Dr. Weir, I think you're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Claire used to tell me I loved  the Event Horizon more than I loved  her. I told her that wasn't true, I  just knew the Event Horizon better,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be hard, being so far away  from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I miss her. She died. Two years  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir keeps his attention focused on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things happen. (reacting to something  on the screen) Wait a minute, that's not right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fingers fly across the keyboard, double-checking the d Miller leans over Weir's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something, Dr. Weir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Event Horizon's computer think's  it's 2034.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. The ship's internal clock  is off by seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a power interruption crashed  the system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there's no evidence of a surge  or spike of any kind. It's as if  time just... stopped for seven years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explanation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intense gravitational fields effect  the passage of time, it's possible... (beat) Black holes make sense on paper,  it's all math, you see, but as to  what really happened... (he shakes his head) The Event Horizon has passed beyond  our plane of reality, and like  Lazarus, returned from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERCOM interrupts them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Captain Miller, Dr. Weir? I found  the final log entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters sits at the workstation. Miller, DJ and Weir stand behind her, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jumpy, handheld camera view of: Gravity couch bay. Two crewmen checking electronics modul The ship is well-lit, clean, no sign of debris. The narra voice is excited and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have reached safe distance and  are preparing to engage the gravity  drive and open the gateway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speaker is the mission  commander...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) John Kilpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second Containment. A lone engineer finishes his check of the Core. He turns to the camera and gives a self-conscio "thumbs-up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get this message, God  willing, we will reach the solar  system of Proxima Centauri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if they ever made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corridor. The entire original crew assembled, playing cat with the stuffed dog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say how proud I am of  my crew. I'd like to name my station  heads Chris Chambers, Janice Rubin,  Dick Smith, Tom Fender and Stacie  Collins. And to Bill Weir and all  the scientists that got us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge. KILPACK addresses the camera. His face is flushed with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... uh, I had something historic to  say, and I wrote it down but I... I  can't find it. Ave, atque, vale.  Hail and farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURST of static... ...followed by an inhuman HOWL of FEEDBACK, like screamin hyaenas, almost alive. Through the swirl of static, the  suggestion of movement. Miller freezes the frame. He squints at the screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obscured by static, the image is blurred beyond comprehen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? Dr. Weir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can run the image through a series  of filters, try to clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the lights fade out. Dim emergency lighting sna on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A power drain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We barely have enough power for life  support as it is, if we can't stop  the drain, we're not gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Core...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Weir has vanished into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of you, stay here, I don't  want anyone else going near that  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller follows after Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second Containment Seal opens. Weir is about to enter when Miller stops him. He checks a Geiger counter. It is  silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No radiation. What's causing the  drain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir crosses to a console. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) The magnetic fields are holding.  Maybe a short in the fail-safe  circuit. I'll check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller assists Weir in removing bolts from an access pane The panel falls away, revealing a cramped duct leading in the ship's circuitry. Weir climbs into the duct. Miller hands him a flashlight a toolkit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't get the power back, our  air's gonna go bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the Core for radiation. Carbon  dioxide may be the least of our  worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir begins to crawl into the depths of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir's breath ECHOES in the cramped shaft. He counts off  circuit panels as he goes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E-three... E-five... E-seven... where  are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller slogs through the coolant to the Core. Stares at i It remains metallic, mundane. He pulls out a Geiger counter and crosses to the reactor  shell. Examines a gleaming weld. The Geiger counter CLICK slowly: no leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yellow light starts flashing on the engineering board.  Starck's eyes widen: the engineering sections flash  yellow...and green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the bio-scan goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Skipper, the bio-scan just went off  the scale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin shakes on the bed in an epileptic fit. DJ rushes t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin! Can you hear me? Justin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin's eyes remain unfocused, unseeing as he tries to s DJ leans in close, trying to hear him speak... Justin arches in agony and the words come in a strangled, tortured voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DARK IS COMING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stops before module E-12. Hears a faint HISSING and  POPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses a screwdriver to open up the module. Reveals a se of circuit boards. One SPARKS. Weir plucks the damaged ch and starts running a by-pass. His flashlight flickers. He bangs it against the duct wal It grows dimmer. Goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Captain Miller? I, uh, I seem to  have a problem with my light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single DRIP of water in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, hushed) Captain Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another DRIP, then a woman's VOICE like a distant echo:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir starts at the sound. He recognizes the voice. She speaks again, no longer far away, but a close WHISPER his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy. Help me. I'm so cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir's eyes open wide in hope and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the emergency lights go out. Total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just lost all power in here. Dr.  Weir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's voice trails off as he looks towards the Core. A red glow reflects across his eyes. He takes a few steps a from the reactor. He stares... ...at the BURNING MAN, standing before the Core. The deep ROAR of its conflagration fills the containment. It slowly turns and raises its arm and points at Miller i accusation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stares as the Burning Man turns and vanishes into bulkhead, leaving the wall blackened and burned with his  passing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total darkness. Weir's breath ECHOES in the cramped metal space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Claire...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir bangs his flashlight. Again. Again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. I'm so cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight flickers... Claire's face is inches from Weir's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His flashlight flickers again, snaps on... She is gone. Weir lets his head fall to the floor of the  deck, breathing in ragged SOBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew, except for Cooper. DJ whets a scalpel against t leg of his jumpsuit, an unconscious gesture. FLICK. FLICK FLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carbon dioxide poisoning produces  hallucinations, impaired judgement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, DJ, it was not a  hallucination! I saw a man, he was  on fire. And then he disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe one of the original crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the question) Dr. Weir, you were right there, you  must have heard something, seen  something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I saw nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All heads turn to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an hour ago. In medical. I saw  my son. He was lying on one of the  examination tables and his legs  were... (she trails off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it possible that you were  traumatized by finding the body on  the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen bodies before. This is  different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls silent, unwilling to say more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters is right. Its like something  reaching into your mind. Seeing your  thoughts and making them real. Smith,  did you or Cooper experience anything  unusual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, leaning against the doorway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see anything and I don't  have to see anything. This ship is  fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for that scientific  analysis, Mister Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Hey! You don't need to be a scientist  figure it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir's face is stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you break all the laws of physics,  you think there won't be a price?  You already killed the first crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ lays one hand on Smith's shoulder to calm him... Smith reacts violently, turning on DJ, shoving him back. uses Smith's momentum to spin the pilot into the wall. He presses his scalpel just below Smith's ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ freezes. The scalpel falls from his hands. He releases Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I... I don't know why I  did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) Carbon dioxide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith goes for Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking lying, you know  something...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller heads him off, grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, that's enough for one  day, Smith! I need you back on the  Clark, I need you calm, I need you  using your head, you make a mistake  out there, none of are getting home,  you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith calms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outside, go back to work. I'll  join you shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a long way from home and we're  in a bad place. Let's not make it  worse. If anyone has any constructive  suggestions, now is the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can stabilize the fields  around the singularity, that should  prevent another power drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To conserve our oxygen, we should  severely restrict our activity. Anyone  who can should get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need sleep, DJ. I need  answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller exits. Starck follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not slowing) What is it, Starck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I ran the bio-scan with the DNA/RNA  filter. The results were bio-readings  of indeterminate origin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) "...bio-readings of indeterminate  origin," don't you have anything  useful to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a another surge in the bio- readings right before you... you saw  what you saw. We picked up a similar  readings right before the Clarke was  damaged. What if there were a  connection between the two? The  gravity waves, the hallucination,  all part of an defensive reaction,  like an immune system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller starts walking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Starck enter the Airlock Bay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what? What are you saying? This  ship is alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that, I said the bio- readings correspond to what happened  to you, the ship is reacting to us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hanging on by our fingernails  and you're giving me bullshit  stories...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bullshit, it's the only  conclusion the data supports...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck, do you know how crazy that  sounds? It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Miller allows himself to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you knew it was impossible, then  why'd you waste my time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted an answer. And  that's the only one I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller pulls an EVA suit from the wall, starts putting it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want is to survive the next  ten hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks her watch) Nine hours and twenty-two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going outside to work on the  Clark. And Starck... don't tell anyone  what you just told me. We've got  enough to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. He locks his helmet into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship seems to breathe. The lights flicker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE. The ship seems to breathe. The lights  flicker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE. The ship seems to breathe. The lights  flicker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters has fallen asleep in her chair. On the threshold of hearing, a distant POUNDING. Not a  heartbeat. Metal on metal. Something trying to get out.  Something trying to get in. Peters wakes with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. Justin lies on the floor in a heap, completely covered by his sheet. She crosses to him. Pulls back the  sheet... Revealing empty nitrogen tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, eyes widening, as... The IV bottles fill with blood. Blood fills the X-ray  lightboxes, it surges up from gutters in the floor... And the pounding grows louder... LOUDER... almost to  Medical... The spell breaks and she RUNS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters sprints, the SOUND BOOMING after her, almost on he heels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters darts into the Bridge Antechamber. She SLAMS the  pressure door shut behind her, CUTTING OFF the sound. She turns. Weir, DJ, Starck look up from their work, star at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hear it? You must have  heard it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Peters starts to LAUGH, part hysteria, part relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ crosses to Peters, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches out to touch her...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM. BOOM. BOOM. POUNDING ON THE DOOR ITSELF
dialogues.text: Peters SCREAMS. DJ clutches her to him, backs away from t door. The POUNDING grows louder. LOUDER. The door vibrates with each blow Starck puts her hands over her ears. Peters SCR at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the POUNDING intensifies, metal GROANING under incred pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to be heard) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir slowly walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wants me. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck grabs him. He tries to shake her off, but she trap his arm in a wrist-lock. He turns on her, his face furiou ...and the POUNDING stops. They remain frozen for a momen Afraid to breathe. Weir shakes the trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our current environment, Dr. Weir,  self-control is an asset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the POUNDING begins again. Moving away f them. The ship systems station BEEPS. A warning light flashes o the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forward airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Miller, Smith, Cooper, any of you in  the airlock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) That's a negative, Starck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realization) Justin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters, Starck and DJ rush from the Bridge, leaving Weir  behind.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLOCKS
dialogues.text: Peters leads Starck and DJ down the corridor towards the  Forward Airlock bay. They round a corner in time to see a figure moving in the Airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race into the bay even as Justin steps into the Airl He is naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin turns and stares through them with cold eyes. He  reaches out to the airlock control. The pressure door shuts with a HISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Smith and Cooper cling to the Lewis and Clark's h They carefully remove an access panel, revealing scorched wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to re-route through the  port conduit to the APU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the accumulator...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck's VOICE breaks in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Miller, come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in there, Starck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin's in the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck at the intercom. The others huddle by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's awake, he's in the airlock,  he's not wearing a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cooper) Stay here! Don't stop working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Justin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller swings his body around, heads across the umbilicus the Event Horizon. He moves in great leaps, using the mag plates in his gloves and boots to keep from drifting off  into Neptune's thin atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck works the airlock control panel without success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's engaged the override.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shut it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the Airlock access panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try. DJ, you better get your  bag of tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ nods, runs off. Peters bangs on the Airlock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin! Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters' voice barely penetrates the pressure door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin turns off the artificial gravity. He begins to flo gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller moves like a frantic spider across the surface of Event Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way, Starck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) You better hurry. He's engaged the  override, we can't open the inner  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller curses under his breath, moves even faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters, against the window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) The door, Justin! Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fixes his gaze upon the outer airlock door. And beyond it, space. He speaks in a flat monotone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are stunned to hear his voice. Peters answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, Justin, we heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) It gets inside you. It shows you  things... horrible things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...can't describe it... there are no  words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir sits alone, listening to the VOICES on the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) What, Justin, what shows you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) It won't stop, it goes on and on and  on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) What does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) The dark inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOW MOAN escapes Weir's lips. He cradles his head in hi hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller races across the surface of the Event Horizon, the only sounds, his LABOURED BREATHING, and Justin's torture VOICE, patched through on his radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) ...It's inside and it eats and eats  until there's nothing left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) "The dark inside..."? I don't  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) From the Other Place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other crew, they're there, they're  waiting for me. They're waiting for  you. I won't go back there... I  won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters presses her face against the Airlock window, tryin to calm him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin, look at me. Look at me. Open  this door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ runs up with his medkit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she can talk him down.  We need a sedative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he opens the outer door he'll  turn inside-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck's hands fly as she re-wires the circuits. Sweat be her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Come on, Baby-bear, open this door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin looks at her with dead eyes. He reaches out to gen touch the glass between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could see the things I've  seen, you wouldn't try to stop me.  You'd come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin's hand moves to the OUTER AIRLOCK DOOR control.  Hesitates... then floats to the OUTER AIRLOCK control. Hi it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) NOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yellow warning light flashes. A warning klaxon WHOOPS,  deafening. Justin jerks his hands to his ears, closes his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand-by for decompression. Thirty  seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin opens his eyes as if waking from a dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mama-Bear... what are doing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he realizes where he is...and what is about to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god OH MY GOD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! The inner door can't open  once the outer door has been  triggered, it would decompress the  entire ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) You gotta open, you gotta stop it,  please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something, oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Skipper, Justin just activated the  door. It's on a thirty second delay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller moves through the Event Horizon superstructure,  recklessly leaping from one beam to another, trying to bu up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patch me through to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, you gotta help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tell them to open the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) They can't do that Justin, now listen  carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller moves faster and faster, his BREATH echoing in his helmet. He can see the exterior airlock just beyond a dee chasm in the ship's superstructure. If he misses this jum Justin will not be the only man to die today. He doesn't hesitate but leaps, soaring across the chasm  towards the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) ...I don't want to die...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to die! Not today!  I want you to do exactly as I say  and I'm gonna get you out of there,  alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't... I gotta get out of  here... Skipper, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Justin. I won't let you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's words give Justin hope. He regains some control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin breathes hard and follows Miller's hurried  instructions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Tuck yourself into a crouched  position, shut your eyes as tight as  you can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller lands on the superstructure opposite the exterior  airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Exhale everything you got, Baby Bear,  we can't have any air in those lungs,  blow it all out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin goes into a fetal crouch and covers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheezes out all his air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller squats on the girder, ready to push off. He focuse on the 5 meters of space between him and the airlock... The outer doors OPEN... The rush of escaping atmosphere carries Justin's body out Miller pushes off... catches Justin's body... sending the both back towards the open Airlock... Ice forms on Justin's body. His veins bulge. Blood founta from his noise and mouth, forming a red icicle over his f Miller pulls him into the Airlock. Five seconds have pass since the airlock door opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller closes the Airlock behind them. Air HISSES into th chamber. Justin's body hits the deck as "normal" gravity  exerts itself. Miller opens the Inner Door. Peters and DJ rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Justin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ puts a tube in the Justin's mouth immediately, feeding him oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a pulse, he's alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 over 50 and falling... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crashing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood bubbles from Justin's mouth and eyes. He GASPS, the SCREAMS, spraying blood from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can breathe. That's good. Let's  get him to Medical, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck helps DJ and Peters carry Justin from the Airlock. Miller sits there, exhausted. Reaches up and pulls his he off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir listens to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Intubate, pure oxygen feed, get the  nitrogen out of his blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) His peritoneum has ruptured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) One thing at a time, let's keep him  breathing. Start the drip, 15cc's  fibrinogen, Christ, he's bleeding  out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the tanks has been activated. Swaddled in bandages Justin floats within, suspended in green gel. The others DJ, Starck, Peters, Miller, Weir -- look exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll live... if we ever make it  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CO2 levels will reach toxic levels  in four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters stands, looking at Justin's ravaged form floating the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Peters. We need to know what happened  to the crew. Before it happens to  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I'll get back to the log. But on the  bridge, I won't go back, back in  there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin said something about, "The  dark inside me..." What did he mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your "expert opinion?" The  only answer we've had out of you is  "I don't know."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin just tried to kill himself.  The man is clearly insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you explain your own  behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bridge. You said "it" wanted  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir glances at Justin...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But it's not Justin in the tank. It's his wife CLAIRE, na wet, dead. Weir stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir blinks. Justin floats in the grav couch. Weir turns  back to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember saying that. (covers with a joke) Maybe I'm insane, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller follows Weir out of the Gravity Couch Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what caused that noise.  I want to know why one of my crew  tried to throw himself out of the  airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thermal changes in the hull could  have caused the metal to expand and  contract very suddenly, causing  reverberations --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) That's bullshit and you know it! You  built this fucking ship and all I've  heard from you is bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said this ship creates a  gateway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what? Where did this ship go?  Where did you send it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where has it been for the past seven  years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Other Place," what is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I DON'T KNOW! (beat, calm again) I don't know. There's a lot of things  going on here that I don't understand.  Truth takes time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what we don't have,  Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller moves through the maze of the ship, heading for th Bridge. As he reaches a junction, he hears... ...A DISTANT CRY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller wheels like a cat, staring wildly down the branchi corridors. Nothing. He is alone. Miller leans against the wall, sink to the floor, rests his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grotesque ship continues it's orbit as the moon Trito eclipses the sun. Darkness swallows all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ enters, checks Justin's display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ turns, surprised. Miller sits, barely visible in the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No change. (beat) I've analyzed Justin's blood samples.  There's no evidence of excessive  levels of carbon dioxide. Or anything  else out of ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grim LAUGH from Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. Justin just climbed  into the airlock because he felt  like it. Just one of those things. (beat) I swore I'd never lose another man.  I came close today. Real close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Another man?" Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller nods, pulls his service medal from beneath his  jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was on the Goliath. There was  this bosun, Corrick, a young guy, a  lot like Justin. Edmund Corrick,  from Decatur, Georgia. He got caught  when the pressure doors sealed, one  closed on his arm. Severed it at the  wrist. The pain of that must have  been... He passed out and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller trails off. DJ waits patiently. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, I tried to go back for him, to  save him, but I couldn't get to him  in time. The fire... Have you ever  seen fire in zero-gravity? It's like  a liquid, it slides over everything.  It was like a wave breaking over  him, a wave of fire. And then he was  gone. (beat) I never told anyone until now. But  this ship knew, DJ. It knows about  the Goliath, it knows about Corrick.  It knows our secrets. It knows what  we're afraid of. (beat, wan smile) And now you're going to tell me it's  carbon dioxide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sees something in DJ's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been listening to the  transmission. And I think Houston  made a mistake in the translation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ plays the recording again. Stops it abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thought it said, "Liberatis  me," "Save me," but it's not "me."  It's "tutemet:" "Save yourself."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a distress call. It's a  warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very hard to make out, but listen  to this final part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays the recording again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear it? Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like "ex infera:" "ex,"  from; "infera," the ablative case of  "inferi." "Hell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Save yourself. From Hell." (beat) What are you saying, are you saying  that this ship is possessed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't believe in that sort of  thing. (beat) But if Dr. Weir is right, this ship  has passed beyond the boundaries of  our universe, of reality. Who knows  where this ship has been... What  it's seen... (beat) And what it's brought back with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ looks at Miller. He does not have an answer. The inter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Captain Miller, we're ready to  repressurize the Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stands in his EVA suit in the darkened bridge. He  twists a manual valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper looks at Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, mist flows from the vents into the bridge filling it with atmosphere. Miller watches the pressure r on his suit gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) It's holding... She's holding...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) We're still venting trace gasses,  gimme twenty minutes to plug the  hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Coop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller removes his helmet. Breathes deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters sits in front of the screen. The log is still  distorted. Frustrated, she types in a series of instructions. Get to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Peters, the process refines, accelerates... pieces coming together like a jigsaw... Peters turns around. Sees the screen. The coffee slips fr her hand to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiny voice) Starck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck turns, sees the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus. Miller... MILLER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Starck, DJ watch the video. Peters turns away,  miserable. Unable to watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still distorted by static and roll, but finally lucid: FO ORIGINAL CREW of the Event Horizon. On the Bridge. ONE MAN dislocates his shoulder with a WET POPPING sound he shoves his arm down his own throat. Blood bubbles from his nose. With a SHUCKING sound, he pulls his stomach out his mouth... Behind him, a MAN and WOMAN fuck, covered with blood. She bites through his neck. His head lolls to the other side. She buries her face in the torn flesh as he thrusts into again and again... Presiding over them, KILPACK. His eyes are bloody holes. hands reach out in offering. In the palms of his hands, h eyes. Kilpack opens his mouth and speaks with an INHUMAN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberatis tutemet ex infera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller switches off the video. No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't, your orders are specific...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...to rescue the crew and salvage  the ship." The crew is dead, Dr.  Weir. This ship killed them. And now  it's killing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane. You've lost your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. But it's still  my command, and I have leeway to  abort when I feel there is an  unacceptable threat to my crew. And  I think there is. (beat) Starck, download all the files from  the Event Horizon's computers. Coop,  Smith, finish moving the CO2 scrubbers  back onto the Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) Don't... don't do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters enters, carrying heavy CO2 scrubbers. Smith stops  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, sweethearts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CO2 scrubbers for the Clark. Miller  pulled the plug on the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About goddam time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir follows Miller down the Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will take the Lewis and Clark to  a safe distance and then launch tac  missiles at the Event Horizon until  I am satisfied that she has been  destroyed. (beat) Fuck this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns to walk away. Weir grabs Miller, wheeling hi around, almost frenzied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill her, I won't let you!  I lost her once, I will not lose her  again...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller shoves Weir back into the wall. The two stare at e other. Adversaries... The lights cut to emergency lighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Miller, come in ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller finds the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck, what the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck peers at the Engineering board:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) We just lost main power again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Weir are barely visible in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Starck, get those files  and vacate. I want off this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases the intercom. Weir's voice is a WHISPER as he backs into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave. She won't let you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get your gear back onto the  Lewis and Clark, doctor, or you'll  find yourself looking for a ride  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir is swallowed by the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGULAR LIGHTING snaps on... Miller looks around. Dr. Weir has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir? WEIR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands. Dr. Weir is missing. I  want him found and restrained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck gathers all the files and disks. Shuts down the  consoles, one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith and Peters finish removing CO2 scrubbers from panel in the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go, this place freaks  me out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters follows Smith down the First Containment towards t Main Access Corridor, carrying the last case of scrubbers She begins to lag behind. A GIGGLE echoes down the First Containment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) Denny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to the Second Containment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL FIGURE dashes through the darkness in the Second  Containment. Denny...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters turns, but Smith is already out of sight. She  hesitates. Moves back towards Second Containment. Again, Peters hears the GIGGLE of a child. The SCRAPE of  metal on metal. She slowly moves forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the darkness of the Second Containment. Peters se an open access panel. She looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: ACCESS DUCT
dialogues.text: A narrow tube, vanishing into darkness. A YOUNG CHILD'S V echoes from far away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: PETERS
dialogues.text: ducks her head and enters the access duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sits at Justin's engineering position. Flips a ser of switches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper works on the patch as the ship's running lights co on in sequence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge lights flicker, illuminate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his ship) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) Captain, we got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was right behind me, I turn  around, she's gone. She could be  anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Prep the Clark for launch.  I'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters moves through the duct. Reaches a junction. Anythi could be with her, there in the dark. A child's WHISPER, too faint for words. Peters turns... Behind her, FOREGROUND, a YOUNG CHILD dashes across the  corridor. Peters turns back. Too late to see. Again, the child's WH draws her onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny? Denny, come to Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAINT LAUGHTER is her only answer. She follows the sound, now climbing into a vertical shaft that takes her higher higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Denny, Mommy's coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters pulls herself up from the vertical shaft onto a ca that snakes between huge oily machinery, just in time to  see... A SMALL CHILD running, disappearing into the gloom ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs forward into a junction. The lights flicker red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her son can barely be seen in the flickering darkness ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk... Denny, you can walk...  oh, my baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna show you, Mommy, wanna show  you something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches his arms out to her... Peters steps forward, reaching for her son... ...falling into an open access hatch, hidden in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a twenty meter drop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters hits hard, lies before the Core, an offering of fl and blood. Her legs twist beneath her, shattered; blood p around her head. Her chest heaves: still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bloody gasp) Denny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denny peers down from the top of the shaft and GIGGLES. C his hands in childlike glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir wanders into First Containment, brooding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I won't. I won't leave. This is my  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir enters the Second Containment. Freezes as he sees... Peters body lying twisted and broken before the Core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Peters...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes to Peters. Reaches out to touch her but pulls h hand back. Her eyes are black, eight-ball hemorrhage dark the irises. She is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do that? You didn't have  to do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir looks up from Peters' corpse. CLAIRE stands before the Core. She is naked. Her skin is  pale and beautiful and cold and wet. Her hair hangs in he face, covering her milk-white eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands naked before the bathroom mirror. Behind he the tub steams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stares at Claire in shock. She walks to him. Slowly. She stops in front of him. Her arms hang at her sides. He must reach for her. He does, putting his hands on her hips. He slides from hi chair to the floor to his knees. He presses his face to h pale belly and cries. SOBS wrack his body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and in the bathroom, she clutches Weir's straight-razo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches down. Slowly, her arms cradle his head. She s down on him. Straddles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Claire slips into the steaming water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his head to her breasts. His eyes, closed. She  remains unnaturally still, only her hips rocking back and forth. Weir's mouth opens, GASPS as he enters her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the razor bites her skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She caresses his face. Lifts his face to hers. Her mouth slack. Her hair hangs in front of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Claire floats dead in the red water, eyes open, hair  billowing around her head like a halo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir gazes up at her, transfixed. He takes her hand and r it to his face. She caresses his cheek. And reaches for h eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MUFFLED SCREAM rips through the Second Containment Seal It begins as a human sound and ends as something else, an alien CRY of rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRY echoes down the Main Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ packs up blood samples. He raises his head at the soun of the CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck GASPS as the CRY resounds through the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns in the direction of the CRY. He begins to mo down the Corridor, towards the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper examines the weld on the baffle plate. It's solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solid as a rock. (into his radio) Hey, Smith...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Smith, clear that airlock, man, I'm  coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith carries another load of supplies. Movement out of t corner of his eye... He turns in time to see Weir disappear around a corner in the Event Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Weir! Hey, get your ass back on  board! Dr. Weir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Smith keys the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller jogs down the Main Corridor. An INTERCOM gets his  attention:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Skipper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) What is it, Smith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) I just saw Weir, I think he was  messing around on the Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something SPARKS and SIZZLES in the dim light, catching  Miller's eye. He looks up... One of the EXPLOSIVE CHARGES has been removed from the it mounting in the Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, get out of there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Come again, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the explosives is missing  from the corridor. I think Weir may  have put it on the Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith's eyes open wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Get off the Clark now and wait for  me at the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, we just got her back  together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Get out of there now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Smith has already left the airlock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...entering the Quarters, tearing through storage lockers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it, where is it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith? Smith! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller races down the corridor towards the airlock, towar his ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEEPING sound catches Smith's attention. He follows the sound to a storage compartment. Rifles through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotcha... I gotcha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEEPS are coming closer and closer together. Smith grabs a duffel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens it. He sees the EXPLOSIVE CHARGE from the Event Hor even as the BEEPS become a steady TONE. He closes his eye and SIGHS...

dialogues.speaker: UMBILICUS
dialogues.text: Miller enters the docking bay even as a HUGE BLAST knocks him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safety doors close, sealing off the airlock and preventin loss of pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SILENT EXPLOSION tears the Lewis and Clark into two  pieces, spiralling away from each other and from the Even Horizon. Metal shards, like confetti, fill the space betw them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper clings to the forward section, watching the Event  Horizon recede as he tumbles into space. His FRENZIED  BREATHING is the only sound.

dialogues.speaker: UMBILICUS
dialogues.text: Miller gets to his feet. Stares out the window upon the  wreckage of his ship, spiralling away. He hits the interc with his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ. The Clark's gone. Smith and Cooper  are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Weir. He used one of the explosives  from the Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens behind DJ. The lights go out. DJ turns... Face to face with Weir... Blood crusts Weir's cheekbones, his mouth. He has no eyes Only clotted, empty sockets. DJ opens his mouth to SCREAM. Weir grabs DJ by the throat cutting him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ, you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ does not answer. The CRASH of glass and steel resonate over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too dark to see... glimpses of violent motion in the stai steel cabinets... the sounds of STRUGGLE continue... ...then something WET... and the struggle stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) DJ? DJ, come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Weir emerges from the gloom. He searches among t surgical instruments until his blood caked hands find a  needle... and thread...

dialogues.speaker: UMBILICUS
dialogues.text: Miller, at the intercom. He tries another channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peters body lies before the Core. The intercom CRACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Peters, are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing panic) Starck, do you read me? Starck...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is Weir who answers. His voice sounds thick, choke with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) I told you... She won't let you  leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller yanks open a storage locker full of zero-G tool. L a nailgun. Chambers a round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches the Event Horizon fall farther and farther away. He checks his oxygen gauge. One tank full, one tank at ha Cooper twists his backpack around, giving him access to t oxygen tanks. He seals off his primary hose and disconnec the full tank. His gauge immediately goes to "Yellow -  Reserve." Cooper points the full tank away from the Event Horizon a OPENS IT... The blast of pressurized air pushes him towards the ship, leaving the wreckage of the Lewis and Clark behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller races through the corridors to Medical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and finds DJ, suspended above the table, neatly dissec His organs have been laid out carefully before him on the steel table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DJ raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, DJ, what do I... how do  I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller raises the nailgun with trembling hands. FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller approaches the door to the Bridge. It is open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stands in the doorway. A figure sits at the helm.  Miller aims the nailgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure doesn't move. Miller slowly circles around the helm... It's Starck. Bound with wire in a sadomasochistic pose,  unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... Get you outta these...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller kneels in front of her, puts down the nailgun, loo the cords. She BREATHES in ragged gasps, opens his eyes.. Then stops. She stares over Miller's shoulder like a deer caught in the headlights. Miller looks behind him... WEIR STANDS THERE, STARING WITH EYES SEWN SHUT. Miller reaches for the gun... Weir hits him, sending Miller across the bridge into a  bulkhead. Weir picks up the nailgun, examines it. Miller slowly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need them anymore. Where  we're going, we won't need eyes to  see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what a singularity is,  Miller? Does your mind truly fathom  what a black hole is? (beat) It is NOTHING. Absolute and eternal  NOTHING. And if God is Everything,  then I have seen the Devil. (a dead man's grin) It's a liberating experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his free hand, Weir reaches for the navigation conso Flips a series of switches with gore caked fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity drive primed. Do you wish to  engage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir grins as he flips the final switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity drive engaged. Activation in  T-minus ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller lunges for the nailgun. Weir raises the nailgun to point at Miller's face. Miller slowly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you miss me, you'll blow out the  hull. You'll die too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I'll miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sees something out of the corner of his eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper. Outside, braced in the viewport bracket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir spins and FIRES at Cooper. The nail lodges in the th quartz glass. A web of cracks spreads out from the bullet the glass SHRIEKING under the pressure. Weir takes a step towards the window, raises the gun to f again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller dives for the door. Before Weir can fire,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the window EXPLODES outward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship HOWLS as air rushes out, ripping Weir off his fe Weir catches himself in the broken window, trying to pull himself back in... A monitor tears free, SMASHES into him. HE IS SUCKED OUT. Miller pulls himself through the door as it begins to shu He is safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns. Starck clings to a console, barely able to  resist the winds that try to suck her into the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping for air) Please... help, help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller hesitates, looking from Starck back into the safet of the ship. The door continues to shut. In seconds, he w be safe. And she will be dead. Miller YELLS and rips a compressor from its mount, wedges in the door to keep it open. He keeps one hand on the doo reaches the other hand to Starck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand! Your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. Frost forms on their bodies as the air cools. T veins begin to bulge, blood pulses from their noses. He Y with exertion... ...drags her to the door... through the door... ...as the compressor tears free, sucked into space... ...and the door SNAPS shut, missing them by a fraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck and Miller collapse against the door. A moment pas between them. Just happy to be breathing... ...and then the AIRLOCK KLAXON goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forward airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck and Miller race towards the Forward Airlock Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter, see a humanoid shape moving in the strobing l of the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir can't be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever was on that bridge wasn't  Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks around for a weapon. Pulls a zero-G bolt cut from the wall. Wields it like a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inner airlock door releases with a HISS. Swings open. Cooper tumbles through, clawing at his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck rushes to him, takes his helmet off. He SUCKS air in, COUGHS it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me breathe, let me breathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay now, it's over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees something) It's not over. It's just starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck follows Miller's gaze to a workstations's flashing display: GRAVITY DRIVE ENGAGED. ACTIVATION 00:06:43:01...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir activated the drive. He's sending  us to the Other Place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to shut it down, we've got  to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? The Bridge is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a way! What about  Engineering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shut it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the process, Dr. Weir  was the expert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go where the last  crew went. I'd rather be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOW THE FUCKER UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We blow the Corridor. Use the  foredecks as a lifeboat, separate it  from the rest of the ship. We stay  put...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the gravity drive goes where  no man has gone before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You prep the gravity couches. I'm  going to manually arm those  explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked for Weir. Prep the tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper nods, heads for the gravity couch bay. Starck foll Miller to the steel pressure door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close it behind me. Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Starck stares at Miller as if memorizing his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller smiles wanly. The door slides shut with a dull THU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller runs down the corridor. Stops at a bulkhead coupli Kneels down to remove the cover from an explosive charge, switch it to MANUAL detonation. Miller runs to the next coupling. Repeats the process...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck and Cooper check the gravity couches. One by one,  they slide open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna activate the emergency  beacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper exits down a ladder. Starck turns to the console,  activates three gravity couches. Behind her, two begin to fill with blue gel... ...and one begins to fill with blood... the hint of dark  shapes moving within... Starck doesn't see it, concentrates on the console. THUMP. THUMP. Starck turns. Sees the bloody tank. Sees  something moving inside it. She slowly crosses to the tank. Peers at it...

dialogues.speaker: THUMP. A FACE PRESSES AGAINST THE GLASS, STARING BACK AT
dialogues.text: HER. WEIR. Bone and muscle are exposed where the skin has finished forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck SCREAMS and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass BURSTS in an EXPLOSION OF BLOOD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A corridor beneath the Gravity Couch Bay. Cooper searches through circuit panels until he finds the EMERGENCY BEACO breaker. He runs a by-pass, activating it manually. The l begins to STROBE... DRIP. DRIP. A bloodstain spreads over his shoulder. He fo the drip to the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He slowly moves to peer up the ladder... ...as Starck CRASHES down, bloody but alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves him away... Weir appears at the top of the ladder, crawling down head like a spider... Starck gets to her feet, staggers away...

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINTMENT
dialogues.text: Miller kneels, removing the cover from the last explosive Flips a switch. A small cover pops open. Miller reaches in, removes a RAD DETONATOR. He arms the explosives. Watches the red lights on the  explosives wink on in the darkness. He reaches for an intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're armed. This fucker's ready to  blow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) ...repeat, we're armed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, he's back, he was in the  tank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, Starck, I can't understand  you, who was in the tank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure seems to coalesce from the shadows behind Miller

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) You have to get back here now, he's  out there now, if he finds you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure moves forward into the light... Arcane runes e Weir's face; his eyes, now restored, blaze with unholy ze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller glances over his shoulder. His jaw drops in surpri as he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir grinning at him... then SMASHES the intercom with hi fist, cutting off Starck's VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINMENT
dialogues.text: Miller backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir stands between Miller and safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, I saw you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weir is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fear. Do you remember the  Goliath, Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corrick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left me behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I begged you. I begged you to save  me and you did nothing. You stood  there and watched me burn...
